author: 新浪港股
title: 英诺赛科午前涨逾4% 与联合电子宣布成立氮化镓技术联合实验室|英诺赛科_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
英诺赛科（02577）午前股价上涨3.82%，现报44.90港元，成交额1.06亿港元。
　　据英诺赛科官微消息，7月29日，公司与联合电子宣布成立联合实验室，利用GaN技术在尺寸、重量和效率方面的优势，开发先进的新能源汽车电力电子系统。得益于GaN技术相较于传统硅基功率器件的优势，GaN功率器件在电动汽车、可再生能源系统、人工智能及数据中心电源领域应用广泛。与传统硅相比，采用GaN的转换器和逆变器功率损耗可降低高达10倍，显著提升了效率、功率密度并降低系统成本，实现体积更小、重量更轻的优势，并减少二氧化碳排放。
　　据介绍，GaN由于其材料特性，可在功率转换中实现系统性能的新标准，显著降低损耗，从而提高效率、减小体积、减轻重量，从而降低系统BOM成本。GaN功率器件的应用范围已远远超出消费电子产品，在数据中心、工业和光伏设备中已实现量产，并被应用于电动汽车电力电子系统。

author: John Arndt
title: Wet Weekend Weather and King Tides Return
text:
Saturday looks likely to bring classic conditions for flooding in Sausalito and other North Bay estuaries. There’s a rainy storm that will arrive with strong winds and a king tide that will peak at the Golden Gate at 0945. These are the conditions that put Gate 5 Road and many other areas of Richardson Bay underwater. Though now there are far fewer resident boats on Richardson Bay, those that remain will face the winter storm conditions that have damaged so many others.
This photo was taken on a calm king-tide day in Sausalito. Adding strong southerly winds can make these situations much worse. © 2024 Robert Sanford https://www.flickr.com/groups/cakingtides/pool/with/27715607109/ The California Coastal Commission is again asking anyone who’s out braving the elements to submit photos of king tides that will be occurring today through Sunday. You can submit king-tide photos to the Coastal Commission here . Woody Skoriak caught some great photos in Sausalito during a November king-tide weekend with much nicer weather. The rain and southerly wind could make it more dramatic this weekend.
Unfortunately, the Saturday weather also looks like as if it will be challenging for midwinters and Saturday night lighted yacht parades. We hope everyone makes the best of it and has dock lines, fenders and chafing gear ready for the winter weather.

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: LSU football recruiting: Five-star prospect Tristen Keys commits as Tigers land No. 1 WR in 2026 class
text:
LSU football recruiting: Five-star prospect Tristen Keys commits as Tigers land No. 1 WR in 2026 class
LSU secured a significant commitment for their 2026 recruiting class with five-star wide receiver Tristen Keys, who has opted for the Tigers over other top programs. Keys is recognized as the No. 1 wide receiver and the fourth overall player in his class by 247Sports. Standing at 6-foot-3 and weighing 180 pounds, he possesses the potential to significantly impact college and NFL play. His recruitment marks LSU's highest-rated wide receiver pickup since Early Doucet in 2004 and places them among the top five recruiting classes nationally. Keys believes LSU is the best environment for his future, both on and off the field.
- Tristen Keys is ranked as the No. 1 wide receiver and No. 4 overall player in the 2026 class by 247Sports.
- He's the highest-rated wide receiver recruit for LSU since 2004.
- With Keys' commitment, LSU has solidified a top-five recruiting class in 2026.
- Keys joins other recruits including Top247 receiver Kenny Darby and three-star Jakai Anderson.
As the season progresses, LSU aims to leverage this recruiting momentum to attract more elite talent as they build towards a national championship run in the coming years.
Bottom LineTristen Keys’ commitment signifies a major boost for LSU's football program, enhancing their recruitment strategy and championship aspirations while establishing Baton Rouge as a key destination for elite talent.
Read more at CBSSports.com

author: Bella Popadiuk
title: Waco MPO receives $1.44M federal grant to test AI technology at intersections
text:
WACO, Texas (KXXV) — Waco's MPO received 1.44 million dollars for the Strengthening Mobility and Revolutionizing Transportation— or SMART grant.
With the federal money– it will test existing AI technology to sense traffic conditions at intersections in real-time. Traffic flow will then be adjusted accordingly. While the grant has been awarded some questions remain regarding federal funding right now. The MPO is waiting until there are clear instructions to move forward. And there could be a bit of a delay in implementing the technology. Watch a quick explanation of how it works:
How new traffic control devices will work in Waco BROADCAST TRANSCRIPT:
Waco's MPO received 1.44 million dollars for the Strengthening Mobility and Revolutionizing Transportation, or SMART grant.
With the federal money– it will test existing AI technology to sense traffic conditions at intersections in real-time. Traffic flow will then be adjusted accordingly.
"Right now, it all works on timing, but it does not take into account how the traffic changes during the daytime," MPO Director Mukesh Kumar said. "So morning and the evening rush hour, traffic that does not signal, don't have to behave the same way throughout the day. This is another example where, with these AI based sensors, we can adjust it so that a maximum amount of traffic can flow through."
Waco's MPO Director Mukesh Kumar tells 25 News with this, each intersection will become its own decision-making unit.
"So with this technology, what we can do is that we can look about 100 yards on all four sides of the intersection and measure the exact amount of volume of traffic that we are expecting at any location," he said. "Then also notice what is happening here at the intersection and make the timing of the signal itself adjust according to the traffic condition."
One example of how this could be used is when there are events in our neighborhood.
"In the downtown area, let's say there is an event, or there are lots of festivities happening, and we want to prioritize pedestrian movement over everything else. So you want all the traffic lights throughout the downtown at that moment, for that specific period, to prioritize pedestrian movement."
Kumar tells 25 News —that the grant is only the first step to demonstrate and test the technology around town.
In the future, he says they would like to extend it throughout McLennan County.
Follow Bella on social media!

author: Caleb Price
title: Revolutionizing Metastatic Colorectal Cancer Treatments Ahead
text:
Revolutionizing Metastatic Colorectal Cancer Treatments Ahead
Caleb PriceUpdated: 04-23-2025 05:39 PM
Transformative Growth in Metastatic Colorectal Cancer Care
The metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) market is witnessing remarkable growth, primarily because of innovative advancements in therapies that focus on targeted treatments, immunotherapies, and personalized medicine. The rising incidence of colorectal cancer, combined with an increasing emphasis on early detection and treatment, has been a driving force behind the demand for pioneering treatment options.
Understanding Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
Colorectal cancer is highly prevalent, standing as the third most common form of cancer worldwide. When it progresses to the metastatic stage, it often leads to significantly higher mortality rates. The liver and peritoneum are the primary sites where this cancer spreads. Unfortunately, for many patients diagnosed with metastatic CRC, the disease remains incurable, complicating treatment beyond typical approaches. Common metastatic sites include the liver, lungs, lymph nodes, and peritoneum, posing considerable challenges for effective intervention.
Impact of KRAS Mutations
Kras mutations occur in about 45% of colorectal cancer patients and have a profound impact on treatment outcomes. These mutations often result in a more aggressive disease progression and present resistance to both chemotherapy and targeted therapies, which ultimately lead to lower survival rates.
Trends in Treatment Approaches
In 2024, the number of metastatic colorectal cancer cases across major patient markets was estimated at around 294,000. This figure is anticipated to grow significantly by 2034. Traditional therapies such as surgical interventions play a crucial role in treating resectable cases, whereas mistreatment commonly involves chemotherapy, radiotherapy, and immunotherapy. However, many of these established treatments often lack specificity, which can result in detrimental effects on healthy cells.
When it comes to mCRC, patients typically navigate through multiple lines of therapy. First-line treatments (1L) consist of chemotherapy combinations such as FOLFOX, FOLFIRI, and CAPEOX, combined with anti-angiogenic agents and advanced targeted therapies like VECTIBIX and ERBITUX. New therapies, including KEYTRUDA and BRAFTOVI, have gained approval for first-line use when paired with ERBITUX and mFOLFOX6. Treatment options broaden significantly in the second-line setting (2L), offering agents like OPDIVO, JEMPERLI, and TUKYSA, among others. For third-line (3L) approaches, medications such as STIVARGA and FRUZAQLA become part of the strategy.
New Therapeutic Innovations
One promising medication, FRUZAQLA (fruquintinib), is an oral capsule developed by Takeda Pharmaceuticals, specifically for patients previously treated with various chemotherapy regimens. As a kinase inhibitor, it selectively targets and inhibits key receptors involved in tumor growth.
The introduction of OPDIVO QVANTIG—a groundbreaking subcutaneous injection therapy—offers a potent treatment for adults with MSI-H or dMMR mCRC, vastly improving administration timelines from approximately 30 minutes to just a few minutes.
Emerging Competitive Landscape
The landscape of the metastatic colorectal cancer market remains intensely competitive, with ongoing research into investigational therapies like amivantamab, zanzalintinib, and vactosertib, which promise more effective treatment options. These breakthroughs reflect a commitment to identifying innovative therapies that can modify resistant cancer conditions, ensuring a more favorable treatment future.
Companies including Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine, Shanghai Henlius Biotech, and Cardiff Oncology are actively participating in this dynamic market landscape, developing therapies aimed at addressing unmet patient needs.
Growth Projections for the Future
DelveInsight projects the metastatic colorectal cancer market in major patient enteric areas will grow from an estimated USD 13 billion in 2024, with significant potential for compounded growth leading up to 2034. Advancements in precision medicine, particularly through targeted therapies and immunotherapies, are pivotal in enhancing patient outcomes and shaping the future of treatment pathways.
The latest comprehensive market report sheds light on which therapeutic options are predicted to capture the most substantial market share. This report provides thorough insights into country-specific treatment guidelines, patient pool dynamics, and epidemiological forecasts, uncovering vital opportunities and evaluating market potential.
Frequently Asked Questions
What is the main cause of metastatic colorectal cancer?
Metastatic colorectal cancer primarily occurs when cancer cells from the colon or rectum spread to other parts of the body, commonly the liver and lungs, making treatment more complex.
How does KRAS mutation affect treatment options?
KRAS mutations are known to contribute to treatment resistance, making it more challenging to achieve effective outcomes with standard chemotherapy and targeted therapies.
What are the newest therapies for mCRC?
Latest therapies include FRUZAQLA and OPDIVO QVANTIG, which provide novel approaches to address treatment-resistance issues in patients with metastatic colorectal cancer.
What is the expected market growth for mCRC treatments?
The mCRC treatment market is projected to grow significantly, potentially reaching USD 13 billion by 2024, with a robust CAGR anticipated over the following decade.
What role do emerging companies play in mCRC treatment development?
Emerging companies are crucial in developing new therapies and innovative solutions, working to meet the unmet needs in metastatic colorectal cancer care and drive advancements in treatment.

author: Yeni Şafak
title: Israel restricts Palestinians' access to Al-Aqsa Mosque for 12th Friday in a row | Politics
text:
Israeli authorities barred Palestinians from entering the Al-Aqsa Mosque in occupied East Jerusalem for the 12th consecutive Friday.
A large number of Israeli police personnel were deployed throughout the city to restrict worshipers' access to the mosque, witnesses told Anadolu.
For the 12th Friday in a row since the beginning of the Israeli war on Gaza on Oct. 7, the Israeli police are imposing severe restrictions that have prevented tens of thousands of people from reaching Al-Aqsa Mosque to offer prayers.
Witnesses said that the Israeli police set up barriers at the entrances to the Old City and allowed only the elderly to reach Al-Aqsa Mosque.
The Israeli police also set up checkpoints at the outer gates of Al-Aqsa Mosque.
Hundreds of people performed Friday prayers in the streets near the Old City, after they were prevented from reaching the mosque.
A large number of police forces were also deployed in the Wadi al-Joz neighborhood near the Old City, and prevented worshipers from reaching the mosque, witnesses added.
Israel has launched air and ground attacks on the Gaza Strip in retaliation for the Hamas attack, killing at least 21,320 Palestinians, mostly children and women, and injuring 55,603 others, according to health authorities in the enclave.
Authorities claim the Hamas attacks have killed around 1,200 Israelis.
The Israeli onslaught has left Gaza in ruins, with 60% of the enclave's infrastructure damaged or destroyed and nearly 2 million residents displaced amid acute shortages of food, clean water, and medicines.
# Al-Aqsa Mosque # Gaza # Israel # JERUSALEM

author: Carlos Guevara
title: Richard Ríos sigue en modo 'animal': marcó un golazo en el primer clásico paulista del año
text:
Carlos Guevara• Colombia.com
Richard Ríos sigue en modo ‘animal’: marcó un golazo en el primer clásico paulista del año
El antioqueño sigue aumentando su valor de cara al final de la temporada.
El antioqueño sigue aumentando su valor de cara al final de la temporada.
El mediocampista oriundo de Vegachí sigue consolidándose como una pieza clave en el equipo 'Verdao', reafirmando su gran momento en el fútbol brasileño tras su más reciente actuación, el pasado 22 de enero, en la victoria 2-1 de su equipo ante Santos, en el marco de la tercera ronda del Torneo Paulista.
En un duelo que comenzó cuesta arriba para Palmeiras, ya que Santos tomó la ventaja en el marcador durante el primer tiempo, Ríos jugó un papel determinante al sellar la remontada del equipo en un dificil encuentro en el que Guilherme fue el encargado de romper el empate inicial con un potente disparo desde fuera del área, dejando sin respuesta al portero rival.
Como lo indicó el portal Win Sports, la segunda mitad trajo consigo una mejora en el juego colectivo de Palmeiras, lo que se reflejó en el empate, tras una gran jugada colectiva que culminó en el 1-1, devolviendo las esperanzas al equipo visitante.
Y ya en el tiempo añadido, Richard Ríos apareció con una genialidad que cambió el destino del partido. La jugada decisiva se originó en el minuto 90+1, tras un tiro de esquina que generó un rebote dentro del área. La defensa de Santos intentó despejar el peligro, pero el balón quedó en el aire, y Ríos, mostrando su técnica y determinación, conectó un potente disparo que dejó sin opciones al arquero rival.
?????? GOL de Richard Rios para darle la victoria a Palmeiras ???? ante Santos en el minuto 90+2’ del primer clásico paulista de la temporada.— Julián Capera (@JulianCaperaB)
[pic.twitter.com/OXJslnr6nX] [January 23, 2025]
El gol de Ríos no solo le dio la victoria a Palmeiras, sino que también aseguró el liderato del grupo D del Torneo Paulista, con siete puntos en las primeras tres fechas. Este resultado refuerza la condición del equipo como uno de los favoritos en el inicio del campeonato.
¿Cuándo será el próximo partido de Palmeiras?
El próximo desafío para Richard Ríos y Palmeiras será el sábado 25 de enero, cuando enfrenten a Novorizontino en la cuarta jornada del torneo. Con actuaciones como la de este encuentro, el colombiano sigue demostrando su calidad y ganándose el reconocimiento de la afición del Palmeiras y aumentando su número de pretendientes en Europa.
Tranquilo, nem tanto, mas favorável... BAILA, REELS! ????— SE Palmeiras (@Palmeiras)
[pic.twitter.com/svdgSgN8Mg] [January 23, 2025]
